channel.title: math.CT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Internal languages of locally cartesian closed $(\infty,1)$-categories
item.description: arXiv:2509.03371v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We establish a DK-equivalence between the relative category of $\pi$-tribes and the relative category of locally cartesian closed quasicategories. From this follows one of the internal languages conjecture: Martin-L\"of type theory with dependent sums, intensional identity types, and dependent products satisfying functional extensionality is the internal language of locally cartesian closed $(\infty,1)$-categories.
item.dc:creator: El Mehdi Cherradi

item.title: Addendum: localization of lax symmetric monoidal categories
item.description: arXiv:2509.03450v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this note, we explain in some detail how one can fiberwise localize a (co)lax symmetric monoidal infinity-category. This construction was tacitly used in Section 5 of our recent paper "On the equivalence of the Lurie's infinity-operads and dendroidal infinity-operads".
item.dc:creator: Vladimir Hinich, Ieke Moerdijk

item.title: Interpreting type theory in a quasicategory: a Yoneda approach
item.description: arXiv:2207.01967v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We make use of a higher version of the Yoneda embedding to construct, from a given quasicategory, a tribe, as a subcategory of a well-behaved simplicial model category, that presents the same $(\infty,1)$-category as the former quasicategory. We then show that, when the quasicategory is locally cartesian closed, it is possible to further endow such a tribe with enough structure for it to provide a model of Martin-L\"of type theory with $\Pi$-types. This mapping procedure restricts so that elementary higher topoi yield models of homotopy type theory.
item.dc:creator: El Mehdi Cherradi

item.title: Orthogonal webs and semisimplification
item.description: arXiv:2401.00704v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We define a diagrammatic category that is equivalent to tilting representations for the orthogonal group. Our construction works in characteristic not equal to two. We also describe the semisimplification of this category.
item.dc:creator: Elijah Bodish, Daniel Tubbenhauer

item.title: Graphical Quadratic Algebra
item.description: arXiv:2403.02284v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Convex analysis and Gaussian probability are tightly connected, as mostly evident in the theory of linear regression. Our work introduces an algebraic perspective on such relationship, in the form of a diagrammatic calculus of string diagrams, called Graphical Quadratic Algebra (GQA). We show that GQA is a complete axiomatisation for the category of quadratic relations, a compositional formulation of quadratic problems. Moreover, we identify a sub-theory of GQA which is complete for the category of Gaussian probabilistic processes. We show how GQA may be used to study linear regression and probabilistic programming.
item.dc:creator: Dario Stein, Fabio Zanasi, Robin Piedeleu, Richard Samuelson
